-บ่นแค่นี้หล่ะครับสนุกมากขอบคุณที่เสียเวลาอ่านครับ

9/10: Bioshock Infinite tops off the Bioshock series by going from the objectivist waters of Rapture to the racist skies of Columbia. All the superpowers and gunplay of the first two, with an extra twist of quantum craziness.

Bioshock Infinite is similar to its two predecessors, yet quite different at the same time. It's still first person, but instead of playing the classic silent protagonist, you're now in the role of Booker DeWitt, a jaded private eye tasked to "bring back the girl and wipe away the debt." You still get plenty of cool powers by drinking strange glowing fluids, but they're called Vigors instead of Plasmids. Most of all, the story is a linear experience that still immerses you in the history and struggles of the place you find yourself in, granting context to the strange and often distressing idiosyncracies that define life in Columbia.

The game uses quantum mechanics and multiverse theory liberally, explaining everything from why the city of Columbia stays up in the air to what Elizabeth's unique powers do. Elizabeth is the young woman Booker has been tasked to retrieve, and operates simultaneously as the "princess in the tower" and "deus ex machina." As such she is naive but possesses astounding potential, able to actualize other possibilities by opening up "tears" much like someone might open a window or a door. Thankfully, rather than being a game-length escort mission, Elizabeth contributes significantly to the fight by tossing Booker supplies when he's low and actualizing cover and turrets on a whim. As a result, there's actual value that she provides to the player, further reinforcing the connection between Booker and Elizabeth through the games mechanics. 

However, there are several major changes that set Infinite apart from Bioshock 1 and 2. Combat is more vertical than before thanks to the addition of skyhooks and rails, allowing you to zip around the level and reach areas in the more open environments around Columbia. Upgrading is now entirely based on money, rather than requiring ADAM to upgrade your powers. You can't hack like before, so hostile turrets either need to be destroyed or possessed to avoid getting gunned down. 

As for the use of voiced characters, particularly in the protagonist role, it's a a mixed blessing. On the one hand, there's actual dialogue between the main characters, and the story is stronger for having those moments between Booker and Elizabeth. On the other hand though, the narrative dissonance is more noticeable than before as well, particularly when Booker goes from providing insightful commentary on the conflict to scavenging corpses and garbage for any stray bit of food or coin he can find. 

The narrative is excellent on its own and is made even better with the Burial at Sea DLC, which helps officially connect Infinite to the stories of Bioshock 1 and 2. The quantum silliness in Infinite sometimes make it difficult to keep causality straight, but it's fascinating seeing the "constants and variables" between Rapture and Columbia explained in depth. 

Ultimately, Bioshock Infinite is a worthy conclusion to the series, taking the frantic fights and heady story of its predecessors and adding in some new mechanics so the experience feels fresh. Definitely worth a play for anyone that enjoys first person shooters with strong narratives.
this game right here is some good shit, I fucking loved it

BioShock Infinite is a really good game. Like the best single player FPS since BioShock 1 (which was the best since Half-Life 2). While this one is not as good as the first game in its series, it is better than the second.

In some ways, it improves on both its predecessors. The graphics are, of course, fantastic for the year it came out. The story is also brilliant. The main characters are interesting and have depth and development. The previous games in the series don't have characters as intersting as Booker DeWitt and Elizabeth. Also, despite the game being very linear, Columbia feels less constricted and claustrophobic compared to that of Rapture. Some of the weapons are better than any of the weapons in previous BioShock games. The carbine and crank gun in particular are great. However, these two weapons are obviously superior to all other weapons in the game, and I found myself only carrying those two (although you don't acquire them until later in the game, so you'll have to make do with what you have before getting them). One final way in which it improves on its predecessors is that some of the vigors are better than some of the plasmids. Vigors like Murder of Crows, Bucking Bronco, and Charge feel more creative than some of the plasmids.

However, there's also a few ways in which the game is actually worse than its predecessors. As previously mentioned, the game is very linear. In the first 2 games, you have an arrow telling you where to go because otherwise you could get lost in the somewhat open world. There is no arrow in Infinite, but you'd never need one in the first place. While the aesthetic and time period of Columbia is really cool, because it isn't as much of an open world, I end up liking Rapture more.

It's honestly a great game, and the aspects are many.
First the graphics. They still sound pretty up to date so far in 2018. 
Secondly, the scenario. Stunning environments, captivating people (either in their neutrality or hostility) and many explorable sites (note here: this is NOT an Open World Game). You should go from point A to point B, as  the previous Bioshocks. 
Let's also not forget the Story, whose plot-twists and philosophical contexts add a lot into captivating you until the end of your adventure. It will surely make you think, and rethink.
This Game erased the prejudice I had with the first two Bioshoicks, which I found slightly boring and claustrophobic.

As for the negative points, I would start with the replayability. There is none.
When you finish the game, there's no point in going back there again just for the sake of doing everything, killing the same people, casting the same spells and repeating the same tracks.
Another flaw is how they portrait conservatives into crazy fundamentalists, which I think is too fancy and biased; on the other hand, they do the same with the Vox Populi, which is clearly a Left leaning group with nothing more than terrorism pumping up through their veins. 

This game had a potential to be even better by making this game an Open World, with so much to show and to explore (and also RE-EXPLORE). I felt it could have been something epic if the player were able to explore/invade Columbia's houses, steal things, make hostages, and scape from authorities. But that's just a glimplse of what could have been and improvement for this amazing game.
Really enjoyed the game and the DLCs, great atmosphere and characters. Have briefly played previous bioshock games and would say that Bioshock infinite is quite different but good in its own way.

游戏史上最佳队友，伊丽莎白是我坚持下来的唯一动力

[spoiler]说起来很奇妙，在我还不知道这游戏的时候，我在b站上看过一期叫“那些游戏里的人--伊丽莎白”的节目，明明已经被剧透了个遍，但我后来得知生化奇兵大名并入了系列折扣包开始玩这款游戏时，我却什么也不记得，蒸汽朋克的世界、扑朔迷离的剧情、超越时空的穿梭。。。对我来说都是一个一无所知的世界，直到本体结局还是婴儿的傻白被时空裂缝切断了手指的那一刻，我想起了！我曾经看到的一幕，通完本体和海葬两部曲后，又看了一遍那期介绍伊丽莎白的事迹，感悟肺腑！[/spoiler]

Diferentemente do Bioshock 2 que tentou repetir a mesma receita do primeiro, e falhou, Infinite nos tras algo diferente, porém tao bom (em certos pontos ate melhor), que o primeiro. Uma historia incrivel com plot twists imprevisiveis, personagens carismaticos, fazem vc ficar ligado o tempo todo no que ta rolando. Se bioshock 1 nos impressiona com sua sensação de claustrofobia, e atmosfera sombria, Infinite nos impressiona pela sua grandiosidade e sua atmosfera bem mais epica e aventureira, Infinite nos tras um gameplay mais frenetico e agil, e novamente a sensação de imersao do Bio1 se repete nesse. JOGUEM AS DLCS, elas conectam os games da franquia de maneira espetacular.

总而言之，这真的是款好游戏，整体体验就像看电影一样（可交互式电影（笑））。dlc的结局衔接1代开头，也算是给这个故事画上了句号。从dlc可以看到哥伦比亚正被红军解放（所以说是处在booker是英雄的世界喽），就是心疼被审问的Elizabeth QWQ（所以说想到1代altas被little sister们插死更让我觉得大快人心(*^▽^*)）。其实我觉得结局也没有那么差，如果按dlc来说1代的结局就是这个故事的结局了，litter sister们被救了出去，回到了陆地，其实也没什么余地了，booker和Elizabeth的结局也没有办法了（QAQ)
最后：Woud you kindly to play again？

BioShock Infinite is a very impressive experience, no doubt about it. They've spent so much money on all the scripted sequences and especially your companion who reacts to so much stuff around her, e.g. you walk by a smoking person and she starts coughing. Yes, the plot is trite, with all the factions being exaggerated and a lot of it just doesn't make much sense if you only stop to think about it logically. But it's not supposed to, this game is a colorful theme park ride and you just have to accept it for what it is.

Gameplay wise it's your average console shooter. Low field of view (even with the slider all the way to the max it's only 85 degrees), sluggish movement speed (even if you always sprint your strafing speed is very slow). Half of your health pool is the so called "shield" that constantly regenerates, so you're supposed to play your typical game of "pop a mole" where you take pot shots at the enemies, throw some fireballs or lightning bolts and then hide behind cover as your shield recovers. While the game is only about 15 hours long the combat mechanics lose their appeal long before that mark.

I still recommend this game, because it's a lot of fun to simply walk around this world and see what's what. You could say it's an interactive movie with some weak FPS gameplay thrown in and you won't be wrong. But then again there's nothing wrong with interactive movies either.

打完给我的总体感觉就是惊艳，在一路疯狂突突突的同时，我也在不停截图，这个游戏的视听享受真的是赏心悦目啊！中间剧情抽丝剥茧般一点点转折，也一点在我心中设下了更深的悬念，最后那仿佛突然炸裂般的剧情转折，真的是让人头皮发麻，久久不能平静啊。或许它作为一款FPS游戏有一些瑕疵，但同时它的剧情却把整个游戏犹如升华了一般，最后一段剧情我基本都是一路卧槽过去的（笑），最后出现的的各种各样的伊丽莎白，让人后背发凉的同时，又不禁想说一句：我全都要23333(伊丽莎白真是可爱！）终于还是结束了，再见了，伊丽莎白，我会在另一个世界与你再遇，到时我还是会救你，哪怕可能最后还是无力的轮回,那又怎样呢。因为我永远喜欢你，我的伊丽莎白......

玩完之后内心久久无法平静，思考着结局不知道该说些什么.....一开始我对这个游戏只是抱着随便玩玩的态度，一开始在我心中它只是一个圣诞节折扣比较大的一个顺手买的游戏而已。我没想到因为这个游戏让我沉迷steam（滑稽）
一开始我只以为这是个单纯的突突突的射击游戏，直到它的剧情在我的面前缓缓展开，我才发现自己已经沉迷它的剧情无法自拔，也让我发现自己对剧情好的游戏抵抗力真低哈哈哈哈。然而就算通关了我也不知道该从何处评测这个游戏，无限拥有的所有要素都是我最喜欢的：平行世界，蒸汽朋克，异能，时空穿梭，以及我最爱的剧情。它给我一种这就是我想要的游戏的感觉。
而且伊丽莎白简直完美！没有伊丽莎白那几段我简直不知所措2333，扔弹药，扔血瓶，扔蓝瓶啥都能扔，变血包，变机器人，变蓝瓶，啥都能变，有这样的亲闺女你还需要什么！
最后不管结局怎样，我都庆幸玩了这个游戏，如果可以，我真的不想

기존 바이오쇼크 시리즈가 사람과 사상을 다뤘다면, 인피니트는 장르를 아예 판타지로 바꿔버린 게임.
바이오쇼크1의 깊은 철학을 좋아했던 사람들에게는 실망스러울 수도 있는 스토리, 사람에 따라 다소 혐오스러울 수도 있는 결말. 개인적으로 정말 아쉽게 느껴지는 소재.
​
게임성에 대해 평가하자면 여전한 불편함과 불친절함이 남아있다. 기존 바이오쇼크 시리즈를 플레이 해보지 않은 사람이라면 이해할 수 없는 시스템들도 많고. 바이오쇼크 특유의 고질적인 불편함이 남아있다. 특히 시리즈 특유의 답없는 총알 보유량 때문에 fps임에도 시원시원하게 총을 쏠 수가 없다. (인피니트는 무기 보유도 2개 제한이라 더 심각하다.) 총알 떨어지면 자판기 찾아 왔다갔다 거려야 하는데 인피니트는 맵은 넓은데 미니맵도 없고, 자판기가 적어서 계속 찾아다녀야 하는 불편함이 있다.
인피니트에서 특히 불편한 점은 체크포인트 이외 수동 세이브를 할 수 없다는점, 그리고 전편과 달리 녹음기 자막이 지원되지 않아 매뉴키를 눌러서 일일이 내용을 읽어야 하는데, 게임 내내 이렇게 하려면 당연히 몰입감이 떨어진다.
​
훌륭한 비주얼에는 좋은 평가를 할 수 밖에 없다. 바이오쇼크 전통으로 연출력,표현은 넘사벽 수준이다. 제작진의 미적 감각,드라마적 표현 능력은 돈 주고도 살 수 없는 미친 수준이다.
​
소재에 대해 얘기해보면, [spoiler] 평행우주	[/spoiler]라는 소재가 아쉬운 이유는, 결말의 모호함 때문에 찝찝함을 유발하고, 설정오류라는 무책임함을 그럴듯하게 씹어버리기 때문.
앞으로 무슨 이야기가 나오든 [spoiler] 평행우주	[/spoiler]로 퉁치면 그만이니, 후속작까지 흥미를 잃게 만드는 제작진의 악수였다고 생각한다.
​
공상 과학, 심오한 결말, 충격적인 반전? 누군가에겐 입을 떡 벌어지게 하는 명작일 것이다.
하지만 그저 엘리자베스의 행복한 모습만을 바라고 플레이한 사람들에게는 그게 무슨 소용일까? 주인공이 하나의 녹슨 톱니바퀴로 소모되는 모습을 보며 [spoiler] (바다의 무덤)	[/spoiler] 다시는 이런 게임이 나오지 않았으면 좋겠다는 생각도 했다. 단지 엘리자베스가 행복해지기만을 바랬을 뿐인데.. 바이오쇼크니까, 그래도 바이오쇼크니까 하는 여러가지 복잡한 생각이 드는 애증의 게임이다.

this game gave me the feels.

I highly recommend.

It's less than 10 hours of gameplay but I really enjoyed this one. 

What they did with Elizabeth was actually brilliant. They took a main character in the story and used her to totally reinvent game mechanics that I hadn't even realized needed to be improved until I played this game. What I mean is, most other RPGs I've played use a potion or bandage system for health/mana/whatever; this game just has Elizabeth toss you whatever you find yourself needing as she follows you around. She can also revive you, so even dying feels smooth. They basically cut a bunch of the typical RPG BS out and replaced it with an actual character that talks to you in the elevator, and it lets you focus on the fun stuff, like sending a flock of murderous crows into a room of bad guys so you can shoot them in the face while their eyes get pecked out. Speaking of which, I loved all the new bio weapons - really creative stuff. 

The story and atmosphere were both quite good. Also, voice acting and audio were excellent. Infinite definitely lives up to the standard set in the previous Bioshocks. I do recommend it to fans of the franchise.

Would only reccomend this in the bundle and on sale. Heard a lot about this game and finally played it, and was underwhelming. Plays differently than the other Bioshock games. A lot more linear, and gets repetitive after a while. 7/10 (with 5 being the average). Also, I played this game knowing the ending, but was still decent to figure out how it ends by playing.

I know i'm late to this game but BOI does this game have a massive twist to it. You play as a man named Booker DeWitt who is tasked with a quest of retrieving this woman from 'The City In The Sky'. Not only that but I also found that little subtle hints in this game [spoiler]made a HUGE comeback at the end[/spoiler]. The array of weapons and different vigors you get through the game are just overall fun to play with and the upgrading system is quite playful too. Gameplay was on point and fits the style of the game aswell as the graphics. Though this game is already ageing quite a bit, I would say the visuals look pretty darn impressive considering it runs off of the Unreal Engine. visuals aside this game is all about the story - it's compelling, written well and has a beautiful ending. Don't get me started on MP. Jk there is no MP. With that being said; this game has a complicated story to it but all is revealed towards end. If you like other worldy story games, then this game is for you.

8/10 [spoiler]would find out Elizabeth is my daughter again[/spoiler] ;D

Oyun bittiği anda balkona çıkıp gökyüzünü seyrederek hayatımı sorguladım. Senaryo bakımından kusursuz bir oyun. Oynanış konusu ise diğer bioshock oyunlarından pek farklı değil birkaç kısmı saymazsak. Grafiklere değinmem gerekirse şu zamanlarda gerçekçi grafikler için ne kadarlık sistemler gerekiyorsa hepsini bir kenara itiyor bu oyun, güzel grafiklerin gerçekçilik ile değil de oluşturulan ambiyans ve sanat ile olduğunu gösteriyor. Elinizdeki sistem iyi olmasa bile görsel zevk konusunda bir şey kaçıracağınızı düşünmüyorum. Düşüncelerimi özetlemem gerekirse şu ana kadar oynadığım en iyi kurgulanmış senaryoya sahip oyun eğer ben hikayeli oyunlar seviyorum ama tereddüteyim diyorsanız kesinlikle düşünmeden alın. Oyun indrisimsiz fiyatını da hak ediyor ama benim tavsiyem indirime denk gelirseniz goty versiyonu ile birlikte almanız çünkü dlcleri ile ilk oyunla son oyunu bağlıyor. Ben bu kadar bağımsız yazılıp birbirini tamamlayan senaryolar görmedim. Oyuna puanım 9.5/10
Amazing game, I fricking love the powers that you gain over the game. 10/10.

When people hear that a game is a first person shooter, the general idea that comes to their minds is a game like Call of Duty, where the player simply runs around the map and shoots people to gain points/kills and progress to the top of the leaderboard. However, not all first person shooters are equal. Just because Bioshock Infinite is labeled as an fps, the game is much more than what its genre implies. The player takes on the role of Booker deWitt who is sent to the floating city of Columbia in order to find and rescue a young woman named Elizabeth. This game not only amazes me with its stunning graphics and entertaining gameplay bua also the way in which it encompasses a variety of different themes and historical references. 
	The aesthetics of Bioshock Infinite conveys it takes place in the early 1900s and has a unique look to the environment and characters. From the moment the player steps foot into the fantasy city of Columbia, he/she will notice the game’s cartoonish, retro-futuristic feel not just by the visuals but also by the futuristic technologies that they city has, such as the complex animatronics robots and the city’s ability to levitate above the clouds. The player will notice how much attention to detail there is not just in the game’s objects themselves but also throughout the game environment, both indoors and outdoors. While walking through the streets of the city, the player may notice how detailed the old-fashioned buildings look as well as all the propaganda posters painted on the building’s walls. I recommend taking the time to explore the city’s streets and alley’s not only to appreciate its depth to detail but also since there might be hidden treasures in it for the player too.
	For almost every video game out there, the game’s genre will correlate to the type of gameplay that the player experiences. Although Bioshock Infinite is labeled as a first person shooter, it definitely has a role-playing aspect behind it as well. Because Booker deWitt is the type of person to go into battle guns ablaze, this type of characteristic translates to a very fast-paced style of gameplay for the player. Because of this characteristic,the gameplay is not too suited for players who enjoy the stealthier type of combat. For example, if the player was trying to sneak into a room with enemies patrolling throughout it, there would be almost no way that the player could discreetly take down enemies without alerting the other opponents, as the game’s mechanics simply do not allow this. On the other hand, the combat gameplay still offers a good variety of ways to take down enemies which prevents combat from being too straightforward and boring. For example, the player is granted the ability to summon objects such as automated turrets and weapon crates into the game environment to assist them in combat, as well as the ability to ride the overhead grappling rails and perform aerial takedowns on opponents. On top of that, the player can use Booker’s special abilities during combat such as summoning a murder of crows to attack enemies or even zapping opponents with a lightning bolt which further enhances combat and keeps it entertaining.
       Another important aspect of Bioshock Infinite is its narrative and how it affects the player’s experience. Since this game is strictly single player its narrative/story is structured through the gameplay and cutscenes. Character development is a major element of the narrative and is usually shown through cutscenes that involve an emotional connection between Booker  and Elizabeth. Additionally, the story of the game is told through objects in the game environment. Throughout the game, the player will come across kinetoscopes which he/she can activate to see a short “vintage” film about the history of the city or a character’s background. Along with the kinetoscopes are the audio recordings from background characters which describe particular events or give information about a character/group. Finding these kinetoscopes and audio recordings not only enrich the narrative of the game but also make the exploration experience more interesting.
Lastly, I want to add how the developers incorporate cultural/historical references into the narrative and game environment. As part of the storyline, the city of Columbia is split into two factions, the first being the “Founders” or the white natives of the city who believe in their superiority to the second group, the Vox Populi, who consist of the the underclassmen of the city. The player learns early on in the game through posters and signs about the division between these two factions and the hatred they have for each other. This can easily be compared to the time period in much of American history when white people thought they had privilege and superiority over African-Americans. Furthermore, the rebellious Vox Populi is inspired by historical movements concerning African-American rights and racial equality. Overall, I think including these historical/cultural influences adds depth to the game’s narrative and role-playing aspects.
       All in all, Bioshock Infinite is a great single player game due to its aesthetics, gameplay, and storyline elements. If you are a player who enjoys action-packed gameplay but still values an emotional, in-depth storyline, this game is for you.

- Eric Baker

This is Amazing

La ambientación es interesante, sobre todo por lo rompendor de su planteamiento en relación a las entregas anteriores. Se presenta como una nueva historia y, aunque el guión no me parece comparable al del BioShock original, consigue despertar el interés y la curiosidad del jugador.

Mecánimamente es fluido y bastante sencillo de comprender, aunque en algunas ocasiones se echa en falta la necesidad de aplicar más la lógica para resolver algunas situaciones. Se echa en falta, eso sí, poder llevar todas las armas como en las entregas anteriores.

Aunque se podría desligar totalmente del título BioShock debido a su contexto, es precisamente eso lo que hace de este juego una buena entrega de la saga: no intenta sobreexplotar un recurso que es mejor dejar como está. Por mi parte se merece un 7/10, porque cumple perfectamente las expectativas pero está bastate lejos de ser sobresaliente.

This is by far my favorite game. Although leaving some things to be desired, the art and story are absolutely marvelous. The first time playing this game is a holy experience, and so far very few things have compared. Sure, it gets repetetive after a while, but you're supposed to play it once. I am on edge to here about other BioShock installments.

Words can't describe the experience of playing bioshock infinite. I've played all the bioshock games, starting with playing the original bioshock with my friend on his xbox 360, then infinite and bioshock 2 on my pc. While I loved them all, infinite was my favorite. One difference from bioshock to bioshock infinite is that Bioshock focuses on the city of rapture more, but infinite has a stronger emphasis on the characters and their stories. You become so immersed and wrapped up in the world and connected with the characters that it's very emotional when the game ends. For at least a week after finishing the game (and playing through the bind boggling ending) all I could think about was this game and it's story. The gameplay is satisfying, the graphics are beautiful, but the story and lore is out of this world. As soon as I finished the game I played it again on 1999 mode. I craved more from the bioshock universe and purchased the dlc's and played them. Absolutely worth it, especially on sale, i got infinite and the dlc's for around $14. BUY THIS GAME it's a memory and experience that I'll cherish forever. Thank you Ken Levine for making such a ridiculously fantastic piece of art.

I haven't played this game in nearly a year. I'd like to start off that I own over 400 games including what you can't see on steam yet I always think about Bioshock's but Infinite 99% of the time. Not trying to brag but more or less make you realize even with all these options I still love this game more than most of them. There is no game like it! This game is simply absolutly amazing and beautiful to this day. I am so tempted to beat this game a 3rd or 4th time in VR this time because programs like VorpX actually makes this game full 3D and isn't even glitchy with Oculus or Vive.  I would always tell people to buy this game. It's still worth $50 if you ask me it was so wonderful. If you really want an amazing single player game that you will think about for years on even after beating the game and still want to play it occasionally this is it! Games do not come any better.

3.5 из 5.

BioShock Infinite is an incredible new entry for this now trilogy, who puts you in the shoes of Booker DeWitt following his completely new adventure in the utopian flying city of Columbia.

The game showcases amazing storytelling and visuals just like the first entry of the trilogy, and similar mechanics, like Vigors, the plasmid equivalent in Columbia, and other completely new ones, like the Sky-Line system to move freely through the city in a 3-dimensional way, or the "[i]tears[/i]", portals that let you use elements in your surroundings to your advantage.

There’s still a lot of variety and upgrading, but you’re heavily restrained at what you can use on each situation because of the 2 weapon limitation, which makes the game less versatile than the first two and forces you to think what you’re equipped with at all times.

I heavily recommend this game for single-player fans, specially BioShock players, as the game delivers to expectations and its story and gameplay are golden. A must-play in my opinion, thought I suggest that you play BioShock 1 first, as the narrative impact is much stronger if you do so.

[b]Overall Score: 9/10[/b]

Sky-high poverty.

Third instance of a Bioshock franchise, that ditched numeric indication due to turning things upside-down, but still tried to keep its meaningful roots in social and dystopian conflict. This time authors had a surprise for you, instead of diving deep into the floor of the ocean, Bioshock Infinite takes you to a city flying above clouds - Columbia. 

City has a rich backstory and life in there is filled with very sharp social commentary on racial and class segregation. However, sunny Columbia with its open skies feels very thin, plastic and even narrower than underwater close quarters of Rapture. Sadly, but this city is just few parallel corridors with no ceiling. 

Visual style is catchy at first, but it’s quickly annoys with its cartoonish character design. It’s hard to believe, that dystopian horror trademarks were thrown away in favour of theme park with roller coasters and cotton candy - nothing “bioshocking” is left here. Same goes for characters: new people might be memorable at first, but soon you can see their one-dimensional personalities with generic or no motivation at all. Conventional “I’m a good guy” protagonist because he is good, classic damsel in distress and evil guy because he is evil. The ending twist is hardly predictable, yet 90% of the story is built on generic teen-fantasy tropes. Worst thing about all the characters - game designers force you to love them based on their looks - not deeds. And this is in game with hard commentary on racism, elitism and class segregation - message was meant to be misunderstood. 

Gameplay has not changed mostly, running and gunning with magic, but this time on literal rails (Sky-hook transport system). To literally hold your hand on these rails, game designers gave you indestructible and immortal companion - the very same “damsel in distress” - invincible scavenger with supernatural powers: need health - here, low on ammo - catch. Who saves whom? Game has lost its stakes: dying in Bioshock Infinite became less punishing than ever. 

On a bright side, artists of Infinite made outstanding job with weapons design. Still not without a grain of salt: to double up variety of items, they just added half of the guns again, but with more red on them. Writers of the story made very compelling ending twist and really clever connections to the world of “classic” Bioshock. Maybe my favourite things in the game are little easter eggs: classic 60s song, that somehow (unravels later) were known in 1912 remote flying city and used in very appropriate places of a story. Additionally, there’s downloadable content - separate short story set back in underwater before its fall. I personally was more satisfied with this shameless cash grab (yes, I said that, you have to buy two DLCs to play it) than a main game.

Bioshock Infinite is a huge step away from the harsh, brutal, but still meaningful and deep world of Rapture. Due to a decision to please broader young audience, Infinite, while trying to be original fresh look on a franchise, became overrated generic and inconsiderable shooter, with a goal to create mass production of cosplayers, cheap artists and porn-parodies. I won’t judge you if you love it, still I wish this was not a part of Bioshock.

Bioshock Infinite is a marvel of a game. This game is easily one of the most compelling games I have ever played, along with a few PS4 exlusives but we dont talk about those. Most people reading this may have already played the game and are just curious to see the reviews of this game from other players who thoroughly enjoyed it. I think that if you havent played the game, you should buy it. You will enjoy this game, maybe if it isnt all aspects, there needs to be atleast one feature from the game, so when you finish it, you will walk away with some feeling of worthiness from the purchase. Whether it be the story, the gameplay, the graphical art style of the game, or everything, you will enjoy this game.

P.S. Expect a phenominal game. but dont expect Bioshock 1
